thread.title: Air Bagan plane skids off runway at Yanghon airport, Myanmar, 1 injured - @AFP
thread.title_full: Air Bagan plane skids off runway at Yanghon airport, Myanmar, 1 injured - @AFP

author: Sean Anderson
title: Air Bagan plane skids off runway at Yanghon airport, Myanmar, 1 injured - @AFP
text:
Share Tweet Linkedin Email Pin Google+ Reddit Print Permalink: http://str.sg/Zdzp Copy 
YANGON (AFP) - A Myanmar passenger plane skidded off the runway on landing during heavy rain at Yangon International Airport, the carrier said on Saturday, leaving one injured. 
The Air Bagan ATR 72 twin-engine turboprop, carrying 49 passengers from the central city of Mandalay, "veered slightly off the runway due to bad weather and heavy rain" on landing on Friday evening, the airline said in a statement posted on Facebook. 
It said that all passengers were "safely disembarked" and only one, a Buddhist monk, sustained a slight injury to his hand. 
It was not immediately possible to reach the airline or Myanmar's civil aviation department for further comment. 
In December 2012, an Air Bagan plane crash-landed in thick fog and burst into flames in a field short of the runway at Heho airport - the gateway to the popular tourist destination of Inle Lake - in northern Shan state, killing a tour guide on board and a motorcyclist on the ground as well as injuring 11 people including foreigners. 
The airline was launched in 2004 as the first private carrier in Myanmar by business tycoon Tay Za, who is known for his close links to the former junta. 
With a fleet comprising one ATR 42 and three ATR 72 aircraft, it serves 19 destinations in Myanmar and also runs a charter flight to the popular holiday spot of Chiang Mai in northern Thailand, according to the airline's website.
